documents.title: mp attends christmas lunch
text: leicester west mp liz kendall tweets
huge thanks to everyone who helped with christmas lunch at tudor centre today , especially annette & maureen !
# leicester
great to see people like you , @ twitterid @ twitterid and more being so hands on in the constituency .
plus that dinner looks bloody nice !
can i ask santa for you pls x
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: your comments : council blames rain for gritting issues
text: leicestershire county council 's response to concerns about roads being left `` iced up '' has certainly caused plenty of debate on facebook .
sarah ferns writes : `` what a load of rubbish .
markfield and the surrounding villages have n't seen any gritters whatsoever '' .
val mcentee adds : `` i saw a gritter yesterday in coalville .
the amount of grit coming out was n't worth putting down tight sods '' .
author: Facebook

documents.title: man and wife 'sleeping apart due to christmas lights '
text: a husband and wife have been forced to sleep in separate rooms because of their neighbours ' christmas lights - which remind them of the blackpool illuminations .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: ex-cricketer to appeal indecent exposure conviction
text: former derbyshire cricketer shiv thakor is to appeal against his conviction for indecent exposure .
his trial in november heard he had been jogging around a housing estate before he exposed himself `` through a gap in his trousers '' .
the 24-year-old was put on the sex offenders ' register for five years .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: forest aim joke at prince over wedding day choice
text: nottingham forest tweets
forest are due to meet 13-time fa cup winners arsenal in the competition 's third round in january .
@ twitterid final day ? !
@ twitterid fan prince harry is clearly not confident of getting to the final this year then # nffc # royalwedding
@ twitterid
why do you follow them in the first place though ?
for a laugh
you are taking the piss out of the club that own your two best players
that 's not the point anyway , how can you seriously take the piss out of us ?
because that tweet was cringe lad
someone with the bio , `` matt tootle lover '' is n't really in the position to call anything cringe
look at your pinned tweet lad
@ twitterid
let 's get blind
hurh cringey admin
haha plastic fan
haha just like your football club
you ever been to your teams football ground ?
yes
yeah , he knows we are going out in 4th round after the bye we have been given in the 3rd
@ twitterid
delete this ffs
he was right then
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: company boss in vat fraud avoids jail
text: a man who charged customers vat , pocketing £ 30,000 he was not entitled to , has been handed a suspended prison sentence .
martyn partington , 57 , of marple road , charlesworth , glossop , charged clients vat through his cctv installation firm , despite not being vat registered .
derby crown court heard how partington carried out the fraud over a four-year period from 2012 .
after admitting the charge , he was given a 20-month prison sentence , suspended for two years , and ordered to carry out 100 hours of unpaid work .
a hearing in march will decide whether he has to pay any money back .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: rugby : return of toomua and tuilagi
text: leicester tigers welcome back matt toomua and manu tuilagi for the european champions cup fixture against munster rugby this weekend .
both are reunited in the tigers ' starting line-up , with mathew tait reverting to the full-back role in the absence of the injured telusa veainu .
australia international hooker tatafu polota-nau , who arrived in leicester this week , is included among the replacements .
we prepared well for last weekend but we did n't deliver on the day and were beaten by a very committed munster side .
now we are looking at a big reaction at home this week .
matt and manu have been training hard , they 're world-class operators and it 's great to have them back . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: watch : christmas money stolen from war veteran
text: a world war ii veteran has told the bbc how he mistook a young robber for a relative and let him inside his home .
once inside harry higgins ' home in melton mowbray , the robber stole money the 91-year-old had saved for christmas presents .
since the robbery the local community has come together to gather food and money donations for harry .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: wasps confirm coach role for blues ' wilson
text: wasps confirm coach role for blues ' wilson

documents.title: your photos : winter woollies
text: it might be christmas jumper day but some of you have spotted a different type of `` winter woolly '' in the east midlands today .
like this flock of sheep in calke .
we bet these sheep in clipstone were nice and warm in their fleeces this afternoon .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: rain washing road grit away , council says
text: leicestershire county council has defended its efforts to grit the roads , amid concerns that surfaces were being left untreated and unsafe .
some residents contacted the bbc and others took to social media to complain that roads had `` iced up '' .
councillor blake pain , cabinet member for highways , said : `` our gritting team have been out constantly since 21:00 yesterday to treat key routes across the county .
however , sporadic periods of heavy rain , which washes the rock salt away , and freezing temperatures made gritting the roads difficult .
`` we are aware of residents ' concerns this morning and our day crews took over at 07:30 gritting major roads and assessing minor routes to keep the county moving '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: rowett not bitter over blues sacking
text: rowett not bitter over blues sacking

documents.title: hollywood star in festive cinema visit
text: it 's not every day a hollywood star just drops in to your work to say hello .
but that 's what happened at quad cinema in deby .
here 's jack o'connell , who was born in alvaston , wishing the staff at quad a merry christmas .
the unbroken star is a patron of the market place cinema .
that 's all well and good , jack , but where 's your christmas jumper ?
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: cities awarded cash to celebrate suffragette centenary
text: nottingham and leicester have been awarded a share of £ 1.2m from the government to help fund projects to celebrate the centenary of votes for women .
next year marks the centenary of british women 's suffrage .
it is hoped the cities will use the cash to teach people about suffrage and the suffragette movement and in turn encourage women to register to vote .
women and equalities minister anne milton , said : `` less than 100 years ago , women could not vote and could not stand as candidates for parliament .
`` by remembering and celebrating those individuals who fought to get the right to vote we are continuing to push for all our political institutions to reflect women 's representation in society '' .
the other cities awarded money as part of this project are bolton , bristol , leeds , london and manchester .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: man in 'serious condition ' after cement tanker crash
text: a man is in hospital with serious injuries after the car he was driving crashed into a cement tanker in lutterworth .
it happened on rugby road just before 14:15 yesterday .
he was taken to hospital in coventry where police have said he remains in a `` serious condition '' .
the driver of the tanker was not injured .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham restaurant voted among uk 's finest
text: a nottingham restaurant has been named among the best in the country by a leading publisher .
restaurant sat bains , on lenton lane , was named as the 13th best in the uk by harden 's .
the company surveyed 8,500 diners , who contributed 50,000 reviews , to compile the list .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: love hearts in the snow
text: look at this - kay carr sent us this of heart-shaped tracks she discovered on her parents ' snowy driveway in derby .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: railway museum in £ 9.5m funding blow
text: railway museum in £ 9.5m funding blow

documents.title: housekeeper stole £ 126,000 from 85-year-old
text: a woman who stole more than £ 126,000 from her 85-year-old employer has been jailed for three years .
tanya benjamin , from ryecroft street in stapleford , was a part-time housekeeper for the elderly woman .
in 2012 , when she went into a care home for two weeks , a family friend noticed that four cheques had been removed from the woman 's cheque book .
then , when he was going through her bank statements in march this year , he noticed that a cheque for £ 126,000 had been cashed .
the bank confirmed they had been written out to tanya benjamin .
the police were able to recover just over £ 54,000 from the 60-year-old 's bank account but £ 70,000 had already been withdrawn , most of which was being kept in a box at benjamin 's home .
earlier this year benjamin pleaded not guilty to theft and two counts of fraud but she was found guilty on all counts by a jury at nottingham crown court .
we had never heard anything like this case .
the extent that benjamin went to gain the elderly victim 's trust and the amount she stole was completely cold and callous . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: paternoster : the over-the-top lift
text: paternoster : the over-the-top lift

documents.title: watch : reptile rescuer saves hundreds of animals
text: a lover of reptiles is dedicating his life to saving those that have been mistreated in leicestershire .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: for the love of christmas
text: there are christmas decorations and then there are andy and debbie blann 's christmas decorations .
you may have spotted this house in leicester - it 's just off the pork pie roundabout .
the couple told me they do it every year because of debbie 's love of christmas and because she never got the chance to do it when she was a child .
if it was down to andy it would be a bit of tinsel and that 's it .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: ex-mp reflects on toyota 's 25 years in derbyshire
text: former conservative mp edwina currie has been reflecting on how toyota 's burnaston plant was initially met with scepticism , as the company celebrates 25 years of production in the area .
the japanese firm has produced over four million cars , including the auris and avensis , since moving there in 1992 .
ms currie , who was mp for south derbyshire at the time , recalls : `` every meeting there would be an elderly person who would put their hand up and ask 'why do we need this ? ' ''
`` i would say , i 've got 3,000 on the unemployment register in swadlincote , 6,000 on the register in derby , 3,000 in burton-upon-trent and they need a job and that is why we are having it .
`` and there would be silence and you could hear the penny drop '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: watch : mp slams 'media blackout ' of corbyn
text: a labour mp has criticised journalists for not covering jeremy corbyn winning a peace award .
derby north mp and corbyn ally chris williamson claimed there was a `` media blackout '' .
but during an exchange on bbc two 's daily politics , mr williamson was also reminded by presenter jo coburn that no-one in his party had announced it either .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: woman was choked unconscious and raped
text: woman was choked unconscious and raped

documents.title: foxes to face fleetwood in fa cup
text: leicester city will play fleetwood town in the third round of the fa cup - the obvious link : jamie vardy .
the england international signed for £ 1m from the cod army back in 2012 .
what a bargain he 's turned out to be .
there 's no doubt he 'll be looking forward to returning to highbury stadium on 6 january .
it provides a massive opportunity for the foxes to head into the fourth round , but fleetwood should n't be underestimated .
author: Owynn Atkin
BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: rugby : nottingham name side for must win b & i cup clash
text: after last weekend 's postponement due to the bad weather , nottingham boss ian costello has the same side that were due to play ospreys premiership select , for tomorrow 's return fixture .
with both sides suffering losses in their opening two british and irish cup matches , victory in neath is vital for either side if they want to stand any chance of progressing to the knockout stage .
green and whites starting xv in full : scanlon , robinson , millett , hakalo , williams , eden , mcconnell , penman , stevens , burke , moon , qualter , morris ( c ) , coghlan , poullet (
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: lottery explains decision to withdraw museum funding
text: the heritage lottery fund ( hlf ) has explained its reason for withdrawing £ 10m of funding from a new heritage railway museum in leicester .
the hlf said the project has experienced a number of difficulties and delays over the last two and half years .

the board had ongoing concerns about outstanding risks including continuing extended timescales , future operational costs and management arrangements , and the potential for costs to increase further .
so , it is with regret that hlf board has decided to withdraw from this project .
we realise that this will be disappointing news for all partners , but we have a responsibility for distributing money raised by national lottery players . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: your bag 's journey through the airport
text: your bag 's journey through the airport

documents.title: arrests following £ 500k cannabis raids
text: police have arrested three men after cannabis plants with a street value of around £ 500,000 were found in three houses .
the plants were recovered by nottinghamshire police from properties in west bridgford , wollaton and sleaford in lincolnshire .
one man , aged 30 , has been charged with the production of cannabis .
police said two other men , aged 26 and 57 , have been released pending further investigation .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: mayor 'furious ' at major museum set-back
text: a new heritage railway museum in leicester has been refused £ 10m of heritage lottery funding .
the great central railway , with backing from the city and county councils , was hoping to build the £ 18m attraction at leicester 's north station , spanning leicestershire and nottinghamshire .
it had planned to house locomotives from the national railway museum and the great central railway .
leicester city 's mayor , sir peter soulsby , has told the bbc he 's `` furious '' with the heritage lottery fund decision .
he said : `` every time we answered any of their concerns they would raise new ones .
we began to get the impression that really this was n't about any real concerns , it was about trying to find any excuse possible to save the money . ''
the bbc has requested a statement from the heritage lottery fund .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: bid to tackle birds of prey persecution
text: the full extent of birds of prey persecution in `` hotspots '' like derbyshire is being published online to help combat it , the government has said .
the maps show the number of shootings , trappings , poisonings and cases where nests have been destroyed between 2011 and 2015 .
it shows derbyshire as one of the counties in england and wales with the highest number of birds being targeted .
the government said it was a uk wildlife crime priority and the maps will be updated annually .

environment minister therese coffey , said : `` these maps highlight hotspots across the country for crimes against these precious birds , enabling the police to crack down with increased enforcement in areas where it 's needed most .
this action comes two months after the derbyshire wildlife trust warned bird of prey prosecution in the peak district is a `` national disgrace '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: see how your primary school is doing
text: see how your primary school is doing

documents.title: all clear for notts bowler fletcher
text: all clear for notts bowler fletcher

documents.title: richard iii could scupper plans for a new strip club
text: a bid to open a new strip club in leicester city centre should be rejected because it would be too close to the final resting place of richard iii , it has been claimed .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: police warn of 'extremely challenging ' conditions
text: a warning from leicestershire police after several crashes on the roads .
the roads are very slippy and the driving conditions are extremely challenging .
we have had a number of traffic incidents reported to us this morning .
please do your part to keep yourself and your fellow motorists safe by driving carefully to suit the conditions .
thank you
motorists have a duty to all road users ( like pedestrians , cyclists , horses ) , not just other motorists .
give pedestrians extra time to cross and leave a gap at junctions .
people need to slow down and keep there distance there was a three car accident right outside my kids school this morning aswell as 2 cars sliding down the road .
what ! ? ! ?
those fellow motorists are protected by metal boxes .
what about pedestrians and cyclists .
take more care for more vulnerable people !
and keep em peeled for a gritter
it would appear that the roads around south leic were n't gritted last night
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: controversial plans to expand airport
text: east midlands airport could be getting bigger - much bigger .
the bbc has been told there 'll be more passengers , more buildings and possibly even a bigger runway in the next 15 years .
fred thomson has lived in nearby kegworth for 47 years - for 30 of those years he 's been campaigning against the expansion of east midlands airport .
heidi barlow from east midlands airport said expansion would be `` massive '' for the east midlands economy .

she said they are working with highways england to make sure the extra traffic causes minimal disruption to people living locally and that extra flights will be carefully timed to reduce the impact of noise .
author: Emily Anderson
Reporter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: sawn-off shotgun owner jailed
text: a man has been jailed for five years after police recovered a sawn-off shotgun , ammunition and two canisters of cs spray from his house .
tony clay , 38 , of stirling grove , clifton , nottingham , admitted three possession of a firearm charges on thursday .
nottinghamshire police said the gun would now be destroyed .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: griffiths extends leicestershire deal
text: griffiths extends leicestershire deal

documents.title: ryanair bids to stop possible ema strike disruption
text: ryanair has said it is prepared to recognise pilot unions as it seeks to avoid strike disruption over the christmas period .
earlier this week , 79 dublin-based ryanair pilots said they would strike for one day on 20 december - 28 ryanair flights are due to leave east midlands airport on that day .
ryanair has never recognised unions , but it said it would change this policy in order to avoid disruption to flights and passengers in christmas week .
the airline has called on the unions to cancel the planned strike .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: thousands object to one-way system plans
text: almost 3,000 people have signed a petition objecting to a one way system in the centre of oakham .
the petition was handed into rutland county council following their plans to turn the high street into a one way route , with wider pavements , chevron parking and loading bays .
gerry robinson started the petition - he told the bbc it will have a `` very negative affect '' on local independent traders in oakham .
instead of a one-way system he would like to see the money spent on something like expanding the local medical centre and schools .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: presenter 'smiled through cancer battle '
text: staff at bbc radio nottingham have been paying tribute to presenter kaval vaseer , who 's died after a long battle with cancer .
very sad this morning to hear of the passing of @ twitterid presenter kaval vaseer .
he smiled throughout his long battle with cancer and always wanted to chat about the cricket .
one of the most positive men i 've ever known .
he 'll be missed by everyone here .
and we were going to meet up for a drink over christmas .
very sad to hear .
he truly was a great person agree , always smiling .
mum was talking about them yday .
so sad
ah that 's really sad news david - he was a lovely man
very sad and unfortunate .
may his soul rest in peace .
i 'm devastated to hear that @ twitterid kaval vaseer has passed away .
a true gentleman who even in his long battle with cancer was always smiling and never failed to ask about you .
a truly lovely man who 'll be sorely missed .
love to his family and friends .
devastated to hear about the passing of @ twitterid presenter and friend kaval vaseer .
an engaging broadcaster who was a real support through my career .
will miss his zest for life and positivity tremendously .
rip , kav xxx
kav always asked about your life - even though his was painful and tough - a genuine and caring man with so much thought for others .
rip x
oh no !
he was a colleague and a lovely man .
shocked .
sorry to hear this very sad news .
kaval was a great guy & he really put his guests at ease in the studio .
his long running radio show 'dhamaka ' had a huge following .
he will be dearly missed .
sad news .
never saw him at work without a smile on his face .
he 'll be missed .
so sorry to hear the sad news .
thoughts with everyone at radio nottingham and his family and loved ones xx
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: veteran bbc presenter dies
text: radio nottingham presenter of nearly 30 years , kaval vaseer aged 55 , has died after a long battle with cancer .
kaval joined the station in 1989 to launch dhamaka , a specialist programme aimed at younger listeners from the asian community , and has presented the weekly show ever since .
despite his illness , he was still broadcasting two weeks ago .
radio nottingham editor , mike bettison said : `` kav was a very kind man , a very generous man , a man who showed enormous courage particularly in the later stages of his illness . ''
kaval was born in liverpool but emigrated to india when he was a toddler , returning to england for his education .
in the 1980s , he worked for bbc radio derby and later bbc radio sheffield before arriving in nottingham .
mr bettison said dhamaka was very important to him because it reflected his community .
`` he was absolutely determined to do the best by that community for as long as he possibly could , '' he added .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: car manufacturer celebrates landmark
text: toyota 's celebrating 25 years of car manufacturing in derbyshire .
the japanese firm 's produced over four million cars , including the avensis and auris hybrid models , at burnaston since 1992 .
at the time , toyota 's investment in britain was the largest ever made by a foreign firm .
the anniversary will be celebrated at the factory later .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: killer lorry driver was watching porn
text: killer lorry driver was watching porn

documents.title: man 's struggle over alcoholic mother
text: man 's struggle over alcoholic mother

documents.title: rugby : continuity key as club seek costello successor
text: nottingham plan to make an announcement `` sometime next week '' regarding a successor for outgoing head coach ian costello .
green and whites boss costello , who joined the lady bay-based club in 2016 , announced on thursday he would be leaving at the end of this season for wasps .

the club 's chairman , alistair bow , said : `` we 're very keen to maintain continuity amongst the playing , coaching and support areas of the team , making sure that we build on the magnificent groundwork that has been laid by ian .
`` we 'll be having conversations internally over the next few days and hoping to make a further announcement sometime next week '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: watch : what happens to your aeroplane luggage
text: have you ever wondered about the journey your luggage goes on when you check it in at the airport ?
we 've been over to east midlands airport to find out .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: watch : the hop-on lift that 's dying out
text: as one of the last examples of a unique elevator closes in leicester , is it hasta la vista paternoster ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: watch : rape victim appeals to find attacker
text: police investigating a rape and attempted murder in ilkeston have released this video of the victim to try to encourage anyone with information to come forward .
warning : may contain third party advertising .
the attack happened in the early hours of sunday 26 november when the woman was walking along queens avenue .
she was grabbed from behind by a man , who strangled her until she passed out .
when she regained consciousness , he was raping her .
this artist 's impression of the potential suspect has been created .
you might come across this image on a leaflet over the weekend as 40,000 are being delivered to homes in the ilkeston area .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: road closed after overnight 'disturbance '
text: police were called out to deal with what they are describing as a `` disturbance '' in a residential street in the early hours of this morning .
nottinghamshire police attended a property on padstowe road , bestwood , at around 01:30 gmt .
the force added that it is trying to establish exactly what happened and the road has been closed as enquiries continue .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: space centre plans to expand
text: the national space centre in leicester has unveiled plans for a multi-million pound expansion .
the proposal includes the creation of a new main entrance , an extension for live presentations , and a new space mission simulation facility .
at a cost of £ 7.8m , it would be its biggest expansion since 2004 .
chas bishop told the bbc that the centre has grown significantly in the past seven years , and that visitor numbers have increased by 50 % .
the chief executive said if the planning application is successful , phase one will be finished in time for the 2018 summer holidays .
phases two and three depend on the centre getting more money .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: weather : yellow warning for ice
text: here 's friday 's weather forecast for the east midlands .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : latest from the region 's roads
text: here 's how it 's looking on the region 's roads :
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: watch : jockey 's ban a 'bitter pill to swallow '
text: jockey hayley turner claims her three-month ban for breaching british horseracing authority betting rules is `` harsh '' and a `` bitter pill to swallow '' .
british flat racing 's most successful female jockey staked 164 bets - at a profit of £ 160 - over 18 months .
turner , 34 , from nottingham , retired in 2015 but kept her licence , so the bets technically placed her in breach of the rules .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: ice closes leicestershire school
text: st cuthbert 's primary school in great glen is closed today because of severe icy conditions .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live updates
text: good morning and welcome along to friday across derbyshire , leicestershire , nottinghamshire and rutland .
amy woodfield and i will be with you until later with the best of the region 's news , sport , weather and travel .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News
